CVE-2025-26465
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T05:15:12.440000

16 posts

A vulnerability was found in OpenSSH when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. A machine-in-the-middle attack can be performed by a malicious machine impersonating a legit server. This issue occurs due to how OpenSSH mishandles error codes in specific conditions when verifying the host key. For an attack to be considered successful, the attacker needs to manage to exhaust the client's memory re

1 repos

https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2025-26465

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-19T09:06:55.000Z ##

Qualys dropped another two OpenSSH vulns this week - CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466

I don’t think either are bad, you should keep calm and patch as per usual.

The first one needs a non-default config, and PoC for the second also uses a non-default config. Neither are RCE and I doubt will ever see in the wild exploitation.

Blog: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

Proof of concept: https://www.qualys.com/2025/02/18/openssh-mitm-dos.txt

##
ryanc at 2025-02-19T07:15:11.472Z ##

New SSH CVEs just dropped:

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

##
0x40k at 2025-02-18T19:30:33.985Z ##

Ugh, OpenSSH *again*... Seriously? We've got two fresh vulnerabilities hitting us, CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466. Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) and Denial of Service (DoS). On the surface, it might not seem like a huge deal, but let's be real – SSH is *everywhere*, isn't it? 🙄

Turns out, `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is the culprit behind the MitM vulnerability. So, folks, time to double-check your configs! Otherwise, someone could sneak in and snatch your SSH sessions right out from under you. 😬 And the DoS? That impacts both the client and the server, gobbling up resources left and right. Server goes down, admins get furious, and users get locked out. Not a good look.

Good news, though! OpenSSH 9.9p2 is officially out! So, you know what that means – get patching ASAP! 👍

As a pentester, I constantly see how underestimated SSH is. People are all like, "Oh, it's *just* SSH..." Nope! Security in Depth is absolutely crucial. Customers always want to quickly buy a product instead of getting proper consulting.

So, have you already applied the patch? What SSH hardening tips do you swear by? 🤔

#infosec #openssh #pentest

##
threatcodex at 2025-02-18T18:21:30.010Z ##

https://hackread.com/critical-openssh-flaws-expose-users-mitm-dos-attacks/

##
thehackernews@feeds.schraads.com at 2025-02-18T17:39:05.000Z ##

New OpenSSH Flaws Enable Man-in-the-Middle and DoS Attacks — Patch Now

Two security vulnerabilities have been discovered in the OpenSSH secure networking utility suite that, if successfully exploited, could result in an active machine-in-the-middle (MitM) and a denial-of-service (DoS) attack, respectively, under certain conditions.
The vulnerabilities, detailed by the Qualys Threat Research Unit (TRU), are listed below -
CVE-2025-26465 - The OpenSSH client...

https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/new-openssh-flaws-enable-man-in-middle.html

#tech

https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2025-26466

##
AAKL at 2025-02-18T15:41:59.433Z ##

Qualys TRU Discovers Two Vulnerabilities in OpenSSH: CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466 https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466#potential-impact @qualys

More:

The Register: FreSSH bugs undiscovered for years threaten OpenSSH security https://www.theregister.com/2025/02/18/openssh_vulnerabilities_mitm_dos/ @theregister #cybersecurity #infosec #opensource

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-02-18T14:42:42.000Z ##

#OpenSSH has a MitM vulnerability when using `VerifyHostKeyDNS` (CVE-2025-26465).

The attack has the hostile server running the client out of memory, which then circumvents the hostkey verification *completely*.

The default for `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is `no`, but if you change that, until you can upgrade to 9.9p2, better keep it at `VerifyHostKeyDNS=no`.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/02/18/1

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-19T09:06:55.000Z ##

Qualys dropped another two OpenSSH vulns this week - CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466

I don’t think either are bad, you should keep calm and patch as per usual.

The first one needs a non-default config, and PoC for the second also uses a non-default config. Neither are RCE and I doubt will ever see in the wild exploitation.

Blog: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

Proof of concept: https://www.qualys.com/2025/02/18/openssh-mitm-dos.txt

Otherwise, someone could sneak in and snatch your SSH sessions right out from under you. 😬 And the DoS? That impacts both the client and the server, gobbling up resources left and right. Good news, though! OpenSSH 9.9p2 is officially out! So, you know what that means – get patching ASAP! 👍

## Summary Problem: Potential man-in-the-middle attacks due to missing SSL certificate verification in the project codebase and used third-party libraries. ## Details In the past, `aiohttp-session`/`request` had the parameter `verify_ssl` to control SSL certificate verification. This was a boolean value. In `aiohttp` 3.0, this parameter was deprecated in favor of the `ssl` parameter. Only when

cR0w at 2025-02-18T18:13:57.074Z ##

Ooh, this is another fun one. Again, the advisory isn't brand new, but the CVE is dated today.

Good thing Atos is small and no one uses their stuff or anything...

As at December 31, 2024, Atos liquidity is estimated at €2,191 million, more than one billion euros above the €1,152 million expected cash position presented in the Accelerated Safeguard Plan

Edit to add that this is rated at a CVSS 9.9 because that's always fun to see.

CVE-2025-21608
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T19:15:25.220000

1 posts

Meshtastic is an open source mesh networking solution. In affected firmware versions crafted packets over MQTT are able to appear as a DM in client to a node even though they were not decoded with PKC. This issue has been addressed in version 2.5.19 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

komelt@toot.tux.si at 2025-02-16T12:41:49.000Z ##

It isn't much but it is honest work 😉.

Yesterday, my first CVE (CVE-2025-21608) was published by @meshtastic. While doing security research for the class Security of Systems on UNI LJ FRI. I discovered a critical vulnerability in its firmware that allowed an attacker to bypass PKI and impersonate any user.

The vulnerability was tested only for text messages, but it could also probably affect remote admin control.

I hope this isn't my last CVE. 😄

https://github.com/meshtastic/firmware/security/advisories/GHSA-c967-qc39-3hf5

##

CVE-2024-51505
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T18:33:22

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Atos Eviden IDRA before 2.7.1. A highly trusted role (Config Admin) could leverage a race condition to escalate privileges.

cR0w at 2025-02-18T18:13:57.074Z ##

Ooh, this is another fun one. Again, the advisory isn't brand new, but the CVE is dated today.

https://support.bull.com/ols/product/security/psirt/security-bulletins/potential-privilege-escalation-in-idpki-psirt-1335-tlp-clear-version-2-10-cve-2024-39327-cve-2024-39328-cve-2024-51505/at_download/file

Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in Atos Eviden IDRA before 2.6.1 could allow the possibility to obtain CA signing in an illegitimate way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39327

Good thing Atos is small and no one uses their stuff or anything...

As at December 31, 2024, Atos liquidity is estimated at €2,191 million, more than one billion euros above the €1,152 million expected cash position presented in the Accelerated Safeguard Plan

Edit to add that this is rated at a CVSS 9.9 because that's always fun to see.

##

CVE-2025-24200
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.04%

updated 2025-02-18T18:15:33.667000

36 posts

An authorization issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iPadOS 17.7.5, iOS 18.3.1 and iPadOS 18.3.1. A physical attack may disable USB Restricted Mode on a locked device. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited in an extremely sophisticated attack against specific targeted individuals.

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-11T14:45:00.000Z ##

#Apple Patches 'Extremely Sophisticated Attack' That Can Hit iPhones

This patch is an emergency update (18.3.1) from Apple. It fixes an vulnerability where USB Restricted Mode can be disabled on the device. Tracked as CVE-2025-24200 and may have been used by law enforcement.

Apple describes the zero day as highly sophisticated attack against a targeted individual.

#iphone #cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.pcmag.com/news/apple-patches-extremely-sophisticated-attack-that-can-hit-iphones

CVE-2025-25184(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T15:04:50

1 posts

## Summary `Rack::CommonLogger` can be exploited by crafting input that includes newline characters to manipulate log entries. The supplied proof-of-concept demonstrates injecting malicious content into logs. ## Details When a user provides the authorization credentials via `Rack::Auth::Basic`, if success, the username will be put in `env['REMOTE_USER']` and later be used by `Rack::CommonLogger

tom@ruby.social at 2025-02-15T09:43:27.000Z ##

@olivierlacan Reassuringly, I think it’s human error: the fix (https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/4aa19786a0aad7ff2ca66eeaede4a257cc7b0726) is in v3.1.10, and the Ruby Advisory Database says v3.1.10 (https://rubysec.com/advisories/CVE-2025-25184/), but the rack/rack advisory mistakenly says v3.1.11 (https://github.com/rack/rack/security/advisories/GHSA-7g2v-jj9q-g3rg).

##

CVE-2024-12860
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-02-18T09:32:50

2 posts

The CarSpot – Dealership Wordpress Classified Theme theme for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation via account takeover in all versions up to, and including, 2.4.3. This is due to the plugin not properly validating a token prior to updating a user's password. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change arbitrary user's passwords, including administrators, and leverage

DarkWebInformer at 2025-02-18T19:37:56.660Z ##

🚨 Critical Security Vulnerability
🆔 CVE-2024-12860
💣 CVSS Score: 9.8
📅 Published Date: 25/02/18
⚠️ Details: The CarSpot – Dealership Wordpress Classified Theme theme for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation via account takeover in all versions up to, and including, 2.4.3. This is due to the plugin not properly validating a token prior to updating a user's password. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change arbitrary user's passwords, including administrators, and leverage that to gain access to their account.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12860

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:37:56.000Z ##

🚨 Critical Security Vulnerability
🆔 CVE-2024-12860
💣 CVSS Score: 9.8
📅 Published Date: 25/02/18
⚠️ Details: The CarSpot – Dealership Wordpress Classified Theme theme for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation via account takeover in all versions up to, and including, 2.4.3. This is due to the plugin not properly validating a token prior to updating a user's password. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change arbitrary user's passwords, including administrators, and leverage that to gain access to their account.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12860

##

CVE-2024-57963
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T09:32:49

2 posts

Insecure Loading of Dynamic Link Libraries have been discovered in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER, which could allow local attackers to potentially disclose information or execute arbitray code on affected systems. This issue affects USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER:.

cR0w at 2025-02-18T14:45:52.567Z ##

This specific vuln is unlikely to impact many, if any, people here, and search path vulns aren't always exciting, but it's not often you see them published in device drivers. That said, it is common in industrial systems like this one to see forever-days.

https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/hitachi-sec/2025/001.html

CVE-2024-57963: Insecure Loading of DLLs
The flaw in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER exists.

Insecure Loading of Dynamic Link Libraries have been discovered in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program, which could allow local attackers to potentially disclose information or execute arbitrary code on affected systems. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities requires user interaction, such as opening a malicious file.

These vulnerabilities allow users to potentially disclose information or to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system.

And the kicker:

The USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program has already reached End of Life (EOL) and is not supported anymore. Hitachi recommends that this product be retired.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T14:45:52.000Z ##

This specific vuln is unlikely to impact many, if any, people here, and search path vulns aren't always exciting, but it's not often you see them published in device drivers. That said, it is common in industrial systems like this one to see forever-days.

https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/hitachi-sec/2025/001.html

CVE-2024-57963: Insecure Loading of DLLs
The flaw in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER exists.

Insecure Loading of Dynamic Link Libraries have been discovered in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program, which could allow local attackers to potentially disclose information or execute arbitrary code on affected systems. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities requires user interaction, such as opening a malicious file.

These vulnerabilities allow users to potentially disclose information or to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system.

And the kicker:

The USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program has already reached End of Life (EOL) and is not supported anymore. Hitachi recommends that this product be retired.

##

CVE-2024-25066
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-17T21:31:36

1 posts

RSA Authentication Manager before 8.7 SP2 Patch 1 allows XML External Entity (XXE) attacks via a license file, resulting in attacker-controlled files being stored on the product's server. Data exfiltration cannot occur.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-17T21:05:36.000Z ##

#infosec #rce #cve202412356 https://infosec.exchange/@catc0n/113997300008493846

##
data_bene@fosstodon.org at 2025-02-15T17:52:53.000Z ##

Have you upgraded to the latest minor release of #PostgreSQL yet?

> Threat actors combined a BeyondTrust zero-day (CVE-2024-12356) with a new PostgreSQL vulnerability (CVE-2025-1094).
CVE-2025-1094 allows for SQL injection and shell command execution through PostgreSQL’s psql interactive tool.

> Successful exploitation leads to arbitrary code execution. Affected PostgreSQL versions: 13–17 (fixed in latest patches).

Read more on HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/postgresql-vulnerability-exploited.html

#tech #zeroday #postgres

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-15T14:40:32.000Z ##

Rapid7's principal security researcher, Stephen Fewer, disclosed CVE-2025-1094 (8.1) on Thursday, saying it was a key part of the exploit chain that also included the BeyondTrust zero-day (CVE-2024-12356). https://www.theregister.com/2025/02/14/postgresql_bug_treasury/

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:35:17.000Z ##

Full analysis of BeyondTrust PRA and RS CVE-2024-12356 in AttackerKB c/o @stephenfewer, and our sincere thanks to the PostgreSQL development group for their quick response and timely resolution. https://attackerkb.com/topics/G5s8ZWAbYH/cve-2024-12356/rapid7-analysis

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:34:05.000Z ##

Finally, plot twist! @stephenfewer also discovered that before BeyondTrust’s patch was released, it was possible to exploit CVE-2025-1094 against a vulnerable Remote Support target without leveraging CVE-2024-12356 at all.

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:33:22.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12356 was patched in December 2024, and the patch successfully neutralized what we believe to be the original exploit chain (including CVE-2025-1094). So neither CVE-2024-12356 nor CVE-2025-1094 was exploitable in BeyondTrust RS post-patch.

The BeyondTrust patch for CVE-2024-12356 did not address the root cause of CVE-2025-1094 in PostgreSQL psql, however — so CVE-2025-1094 remained a zero-day vulnerability until it was reported to the PostgreSQL dev group and remediated in today's release. https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2025-1094/

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:32:34.000Z ##

In every scenario Rapid7 tested during analysis of BeyondTrust Remote Support CVE-2024-12356, a successful exploit for CVE-2024-12356 *had* to include exploitation of PostgreSQL CVE-2025-1094 in order to achieve remote code execution.

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:32:13.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12356, as you may recall, is a zero-day bug that has garnered broad attention in recent weeks as a result of its link to a high-profile attack on the U.S. Treasury Department that was attributed to Chinese state-sponsored adversaries. https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/30/us/politics/china-hack-treasury.html

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:31:35.000Z ##

New #Rapid7 vuln disclosure c/o @stephenfewer: CVE-2025-1094 is a SQL injection flaw in PostgreSQL's psql interactive tool that was discovered while analyzing BeyondTrust RS CVE-2024-12356. The bug is interesting — 🧵on its relation to BeyondTrust exploitation https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/02/13/cve-2025-1094-postgresql-psql-sql-injection-fixed/

CVE-2025-0714
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-17T12:30:38

4 posts

The vulnerability existed in the password storage of Mobateks MobaXterm below 25.0. MobaXTerm uses an initialization vector (IV) that is generated by encrypting null bytes with a derivate of the users master key. As both the master key is static, and AES ECB produces the same output with the same input the IV for AES CFB is always the same.The static IV makes it easier to obtain sensitive informat

CVE-2025-0924
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-17T06:30:40

4 posts

The WP Activity Log plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘message’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 5.2.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

##

CVE-2025-1094
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-16T21:31:43

17 posts

Improper neutralization of quoting syntax in PostgreSQL libpq functions PQescapeLiteral(), PQescapeIdentifier(), PQescapeString(), and PQescapeStringConn() allows a database input provider to achieve SQL injection in certain usage patterns. Specifically, SQL injection requires the application to use the function result to construct input to psql, the PostgreSQL interactive terminal. Similarly, i

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-13T20:55:03.000Z ##

Rapid7 Flags New PostgreSQL Zero-Day Connected to BeyondTrust Exploitation https://www.securityweek.com/rapid7-flags-new-postgresql-zero-day-connected-to-beyondtrust-exploitation/ #Vulnerabilities #Nation-State #CVE202412356 #BeyondTrust #CVE20251094 #Treasury #Rapid7

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-13T20:55:03.000Z ##

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-17T14:20:02.000Z ##

A PostgreSQL zero-day was also exploited in US Treasury hack (CVE-2025-1094) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/02/17/a-postgresql-zero-day-was-also-exploited-in-us-treasury-hack-cve-2025-1094/ #BeyondTrust #PostgreSQL #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Rapid7 #0-day #News #APT

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2025-02-15T21:38:16.000Z ##

"Because of how PostgreSQL string escaping routines handle invalid UTF-8 characters, in combination with how invalid byte sequences within the invalid UTF-8 characters are processed by psql, an attacker can leverage CVE-2025-1094 to generate a SQL injection."

Running meta-commands can extend psql's functionality, and it's through these that an attacker can feasibly achieve ACE by using the exclamation mark meta-command to execute a shell command on the operating system.

#security

##
jimfuller@mastodon.social at 2025-02-15T19:24:54.000Z ##

fyi to all those psql users = https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2025-1094/

##
data_bene@fosstodon.org at 2025-02-15T17:52:53.000Z ##

Have you upgraded to the latest minor release of #PostgreSQL yet?

> Threat actors combined a BeyondTrust zero-day (CVE-2024-12356) with a new PostgreSQL vulnerability (CVE-2025-1094).
CVE-2025-1094 allows for SQL injection and shell command execution through PostgreSQL’s psql interactive tool.

> Successful exploitation leads to arbitrary code execution. Affected PostgreSQL versions: 13–17 (fixed in latest patches).

Read more on HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/postgresql-vulnerability-exploited.html

#tech #zeroday #postgres

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-15T14:40:32.000Z ##

Rapid7's principal security researcher, Stephen Fewer, disclosed CVE-2025-1094 (8.1) on Thursday, saying it was a key part of the exploit chain that also included the BeyondTrust zero-day (CVE-2024-12356). https://www.theregister.com/2025/02/14/postgresql_bug_treasury/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-14T13:03:57.000Z ##

The vulnerability, tagged as CVE-2025-1094, affects the PostgreSQL interactive terminal psql and allows SQL statements containing untrusted but correctly escaped input to trigger SQL injection. https://www.securityweek.com/rapid7-flags-new-postgresql-zero-day-connected-to-beyondtrust-exploitation/

##
thehackernews@feeds.schraads.com at 2025-02-14T05:39:05.000Z ##

PostgreSQL Vulnerability Exploited Alongside BeyondTrust Zero-Day in Targeted Attacks

Threat actors who were behind the exploitation of a zero-day vulnerability in BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) products in December 2024 likely also exploited a previously unknown SQL injection flaw in PostgreSQL, according to findings from Rapid7.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-1094 (CVSS score: 8.1), affects the PostgreSQL interactive tool psql.
"An...

https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/postgresql-vulnerability-exploited.html

#tech

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T16:58:24.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2025-1094: PostgreSQL psql SQL injection (FIXED) https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/02/13/cve-2025-1094-postgresql-psql-sql-injection-fixed/ @Rapid7Official #cybersecurity #infosec

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:34:35.000Z ##

CVE-2025-1094 affects all supported versions of PostgreSQL and is non-trivial to exploit. We wouldn't expect to see it exploited in PostgreSQL implementations more broadly (outside known-vulnerable BeyondTrust RS and PRA versions), given the complexity of the exploit pattern.

But with the above said, it's clear that the adversaries who perpetrated the December attack *really* knew the target technology, which is yet another example of an 0day exploit trend Rapid7 started tracking in 2023.

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:34:05.000Z ##

Finally, plot twist! @stephenfewer also discovered that before BeyondTrust’s patch was released, it was possible to exploit CVE-2025-1094 against a vulnerable Remote Support target without leveraging CVE-2024-12356 at all.

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:33:22.000Z ##

CVE-2024-12356 was patched in December 2024, and the patch successfully neutralized what we believe to be the original exploit chain (including CVE-2025-1094). So neither CVE-2024-12356 nor CVE-2025-1094 was exploitable in BeyondTrust RS post-patch.

The BeyondTrust patch for CVE-2024-12356 did not address the root cause of CVE-2025-1094 in PostgreSQL psql, however — so CVE-2025-1094 remained a zero-day vulnerability until it was reported to the PostgreSQL dev group and remediated in today's release. https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2025-1094/

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:32:34.000Z ##

In every scenario Rapid7 tested during analysis of BeyondTrust Remote Support CVE-2024-12356, a successful exploit for CVE-2024-12356 *had* to include exploitation of PostgreSQL CVE-2025-1094 in order to achieve remote code execution.

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T15:31:35.000Z ##

New #Rapid7 vuln disclosure c/o @stephenfewer: CVE-2025-1094 is a SQL injection flaw in PostgreSQL's psql interactive tool that was discovered while analyzing BeyondTrust RS CVE-2024-12356. The bug is interesting — 🧵on its relation to BeyondTrust exploitation https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/02/13/cve-2025-1094-postgresql-psql-sql-injection-fixed/

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-16T16:53:42.000Z ##

🚨Critical Security Vulnerability in TOTOLINK X18 9.1.0cu.2024_B20220329

🆔 CVE: CVE-2025-1340
💣 CVSS Score: 8.7
📅 Published Date: 25/02/16
⚠️ Details: A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in TOTOLINK X18 9.1.0cu.2024_B20220329.

Affected is the function setPasswordCfg of the file /cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi. The manipulation as part of String leads to stack-based buffer overflow.

It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1340

updated 2025-02-16T06:31:46

1 posts

DataSourceResource.java in the SpagoBI API support in Knowage Server in KNOWAGE before 8.1.30 does not ensure that java:comp/env/jdbc/ occurs at the beginning of a JNDI Name.

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-16T19:19:45.000Z ##

🚨Critical Security Vulnerability in DataSourceResource.java of Knowage Server affects the SpagoBI API support.

🆔 CVE-2024-57971
💣 CVSS Score: 9.1
📅 Published Date: 25/02/15
⚠️ Details: An authenticated attacker with high privileges could manipulate JNDI resource identifiers, potentially leading to: - Unauthorized access to system resources - Data manipulation - Potential full system compromise The vulnerability has a critical CVSS score of 9.1, indicating severe risks to confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-57971

##

CVE-2025-26793(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-15T15:30:24

3 posts

The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount). The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps. Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to

cR0w at 2025-02-18T15:07:05.749Z ##

Another perfect 10. 🥳

Officially. On paper, at least.

This one caught my eye because it's a Hirsch access control panel. Hirsch physical security systems are used in some interesting locations. This one turned out to be an acquired one by Viscount, so not so juicy. However, it did lead to another interesting facepalm regarding CVEs.

Here is the write-up for it: https://www.ericdaigle.ca/posts/breaking-into-dozens-of-apartments-in-five-minutes/

Interesting enough. Go have fun. However, it hardly seems like a proper perfect 10. The description is even more to the point, and while I don't think the vendor is free from sin here, they have a valid point:

The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount). The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps. Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to gain access to dozens of Canadian and U.S. apartment buildings and obtain building residents' PII. NOTE: the Supplier's perspective is that the "vulnerable systems are not following manufacturers' recommendations to change the default password."

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26793

If this were indeed a legitimate perfect 10 CVE, y'all can go pad those resumes with a ton more default creds that are "not prompted to change" on initial configuration.

:dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif:

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T15:07:05.000Z ##

Another perfect 10. 🥳

Officially. On paper, at least.

This one caught my eye because it's a Hirsch access control panel. Hirsch physical security systems are used in some interesting locations. This one turned out to be an acquired one by Viscount, so not so juicy. However, it did lead to another interesting facepalm regarding CVEs.

Here is the write-up for it: https://www.ericdaigle.ca/posts/breaking-into-dozens-of-apartments-in-five-minutes/

Interesting enough. Go have fun. However, it hardly seems like a proper perfect 10. The description is even more to the point, and while I don't think the vendor is free from sin here, they have a valid point:

The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount). The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps. Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to gain access to dozens of Canadian and U.S. apartment buildings and obtain building residents' PII. NOTE: the Supplier's perspective is that the "vulnerable systems are not following manufacturers' recommendations to change the default password."

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26793

If this were indeed a legitimate perfect 10 CVE, y'all can go pad those resumes with a ton more default creds that are "not prompted to change" on initial configuration.

:dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif:

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-16T02:24:28.000Z ##

🚨Critical Security Vulnerability in Hirsch Enterphone MESH

🆔 CVE: CVE-2025-26793
💣 CVSS Score: 10
📅 Published Date: 25/02/15
⚠️ Details: The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount).

The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps.

Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to gain access to dozens of Canadian and U.S. apartment buildings and obtain building residents' PII.

NOTE: the Supplier's perspective is that the "vulnerable systems are not following manufacturers' recommendations to change the default password."

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26793

##
reynardsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T16:22:02.000Z ##

Hey #kubernetes users, it might be a good idea to update your kubelet:

> In Kubernetes, a security issue was discovered whereby a large number of container checkpoint requests sent to the unauthenticated, read-only HTTP endpoint of the kubelet may cause a Denial of Service attack on a node by filling up its disk.
> This issue has been rated as Medium (6.2) (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H) and has been assigned the identifier CVE-2025-0426.

You can find more details in the messages sent by Craig here:

https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-announce/c/KiODfu8i6w8/m/aSBs19ciAAAJ

#devops #infosec #cybersecurity #programming

CVE-2022-35202
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T18:33:33

1 posts

A security issue in Sitevision version 10.3.1 and older allows a remote attacker, in certain (non-default) scenarios, to gain access to the private keys used for signing SAML Authn requests. The underlying issue is a Java keystore that may become accessible and downloadable via WebDAV. This keystore is protected with a low-complexity, auto-generated password.

_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-11T20:58:06.000Z ##

How auto-generated passwords in Sitevision leads to signing key leakage - CVE-2022-35202 https://www.shelltrail.com/research/how-auto-generated-passwords-in-sitevision-leads-to-signing-key-leakage-cve-2022-35202/

CVE-2022-31631
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T00:33:04

5 posts

In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.27, 8.1.* before 8.1.15, 8.2.* before 8.2.2 when using PDO::quote() function to quote user-supplied data for SQLite, supplying an overly long string may cause the driver to incorrectly quote the data, which may further lead to SQL injection vulnerabilities.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T22:49:05.000Z ##

Only because some of you really like to hate on PHP, here's a sev:CRIT SQLi that was fixed in 2022 but just had the CVE published today.

https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=81740

In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.27, 8.1.* before 8.1.15, 8.2.* before 8.2.2 when using PDO::quote() function to quote user-supplied data for SQLite, supplying an overly long string may cause the driver to incorrectly quote the data, which may further lead to SQL injection vulnerabilities.

##

CVE-2025-0108(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 2.82%

updated 2025-02-12T21:32:02

24 posts

An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to bypass the authentication otherwise required by the PAN-OS management web interface and invoke certain PHP scripts. While invoking these PHP scripts does not enable remote code execution, it can negatively impact integrity and confidentiality

https://github.com/fr4nc1stein/CVE-2025-0108-SCAN

https://github.com/FOLKS-iwd/CVE-2025-0108-PoC

https://github.com/barcrange/CVE-2025-0108-Authentication-Bypass-checker

CISA Adds Palo Alto Networks and SonicWall Flaws to Exploited Vulnerabilities List

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Tuesday added two security flaws impacting Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS and SonicWall SonicOS SSLVPN to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation.
The flaws are listed below -
CVE-2025-0108 (CVSS score: 7.8) - An authentication bypass vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS...

https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cisa-adds-palo-alto-networks-and.html

thehackernews@feeds.schraads.com at 2025-02-13T11:39:03.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks Patches Authentication Bypass Exploit in PAN-OS Software

Palo Alto Networks has addressed a high-severity security flaw in its PAN-OS software that could result in an authentication bypass.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-0108, carries a CVSS score of 7.8 out of 10.0. The score, however, drops to 5.1 if access to the management interface is restricted to a jump box.
"An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an...

https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/palo-alto-networks-patches.html

CVE-2025-0111(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-12T21:32:02

2 posts

An authenticated file read vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to read files on the PAN-OS filesystem that are readable by the “nobody” user. You can greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to

CVE-2025-1215
(2.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-12T21:32:02

1 posts

A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in vim up to 9.1.1096. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file src/main.c. The manipulation of the argument --log leads to memory corruption. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. Upgrading to version 9.1.1097 is able to address this issue. The patch is identified as c5654b84480822817bb7b69ebc97c174c91185e9. It is rec

updated 2025-02-12T21:31:53

Trimble Cityworks versions prior to 15.8.9 and Cityworks with office companion versions prior to 23.10 are vulnerable to a deserialization vulnerability. CVE-2024-12797(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-12T18:20:08

6 posts

pyca/cryptography's wheels include a statically linked copy of OpenSSL. The versions of OpenSSL included in cryptography 42.0.0-44.0.0 are vulnerable to a security issue. More details about the vulnerability itself can be found in https://openssl-library.org/news/secadv/20250211.txt. If you are building cryptography source ("sdist") then you are responsible for upgrading your copy of OpenSSL. Onl

st1nger@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-11T18:12:41.000Z ##

#OpenSSL 3.4.1 is a #security patch release. The most severe CVE fixed in this release is High.

This release incorporates the following bug fixes and mitigations:

Fixed RFC7250 handshakes with unauthenticated servers don't abort as expected. (CVE-2024-12797)

Fixed timing side-channel in ECDSA signature computation. (CVE-2024-13176)

https://github.com/openssl/openssl/releases/tag/openssl-3.4.1

##
thedarktangent@defcon.social at 2025-02-11T17:44:05.000Z ##

On top of being Patch Tuesday it is also update #OpenSSL day.

"OpenSSL 3.4.1 is a security patch release. The most severe CVE fixed in this release is HIGH.

- Fixed RFC7250 handshakes with unauthenticated servers don't abort as expected. (CVE-2024-12797)

- Fixed timing side-channel in ECDSA signature computation. (CVE-2024-13176)"

#InfoSec #SysAdmin

sid, trixie 3.4.0-2 vulnerable

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-12797

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-11T17:13:13.000Z ##

There’s a high severity flaw in OpenSSL - CVE-2024-12797

- it only applies to OpenSSL 3.2 or above, which in enterprises won’t be most things

- the feature in question isn’t enabled by default

- it’s potential attacker in the middle traffic inspection, not RCE

- clients can still spot the issue if well coded

So, for vast majority of orgs it will not be a drop everything to patch situation

https://openssl-library.org/news/secadv/20250211.txt

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-11T16:35:47.000Z ##

#OpenSSL has a high level #vulnerability #CVE_2024_12797 with clients that utilise #RFC7250 Raw Public Keys. In these situations the client may fail to notice that the server was not authenticated leading to potential attacker in the middle attacks. Luckily this vulnerability has a fairly narrow scope since only application specifically using this feature are affected (and for example the feature is disabled by default).

https://openssl-library.org/news/vulnerabilities/index.html#CVE-2024-12797

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-02-11T16:00:19.000Z ##

New "High" severity #OpenSSL security advisory affecting 3.4.0 before 3.4.1, 3.3.0 before 3.3.3, 3.2.0 before 3.2.4:

https://openssl-library.org/news/vulnerabilities/index.html#CVE-2024-12797

CVE-2024-12797: RFC7250 (Raw Public Keys) handshakes with unauthenticated servers don't abort as expected.

CVE-2025-23359
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-12T03:31:24

2 posts

NVIDIA Container Toolkit for Linux contains a Time-of-Check Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability when used with default configuration, where a crafted container image could gain access to the host file system. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.

andersonc0d3@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-14T15:09:47.000Z ##

CVE-2025-23359: Nvidia-container-toolkit: GPU Container Escape (CVE-2024-0132 fix bypass)

https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2025/q1/134

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T15:28:41.000Z ##

Alter Falter, NVIDIA! Da knallt's ja schon wieder im Container. CVE-2025-23359, TOCTOU-Race Condition... wer das NVIDIA Container Toolkit oder den GPU Operator nutzt (Kubernetes, ML/AI, aufgepasst!), sollte schleunigst updaten! Sonst gibts Container-Escape vom Feinsten.

Betrifft wohl alle bis 1.17.3 (Toolkit) bzw. 24.9.1 (Operator). Geht um nen Bypass für CVE-2024-0132. Wiz hat's analysiert.

Was passieren kann? Code Execution, DoS, Privilege Escalation, Data Tampering... das volle Programm. Container-Escape bedeutet hier halt Host-Kompromittierung. Also, ran an die Updates! Und lasst das "--no-cntlibs" Flag bloß nicht deaktiviert in Production!

Schonmal nen Container-Escape live gesehen? Ist echt kein Spaß! #infosec #pentesting #containers #kubernetes #nvidia #security #vulnerability #cve

The most `criminal` CVE of the week! ☢️

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2025-21391, has been identified in Windows Storage. This flaw allows attackers to delete targeted files on a system, potentially leading to service disruptions. This vulnerability is especially critical because it affects a core Windows component, making exploitation more likely if left unpatched.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-10T15:12:26.000Z ##

ABB. Again. LOL. LMAO.

https://search.abb.com/library/Download.aspx?DocumentID=7PAA012159&LanguageCode=en&DocumentPartId=&Action=Launch

CVE-2024-10334 Camera passwords stored in clear text

An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could retrieve the login credentials for all cameras and manipulate or stop the video feed.

There will be no update for VideONet in System 800xA. Instead, the recommendation is to transfer to the new product, Camera Connect, as soon as it becomes available.

##

CVE-2024-12510
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-03T21:31:56

1 posts

If LDAP settings are accessed, authentication could be redirected to another server, potentially exposing credentials. This requires admin access and an active LDAP setup.

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T09:20:47.000Z ##

Leute, haltet euch fest – schon wieder 'ne Sicherheitslücke bei Xerox VersaLink Druckern! 🚨 Diesmal geht's um CVE-2024-12510 und CVE-2024-12511. Und was soll ich sagen? Eure Active Directory Zugangsdaten sind in Gefahr! 💥

Klingt nach 'nem üblen Pass-Back-Angriff über LDAP/SMB/FTP, oder? Und ja, das ist es auch! Ein Angreifer könnte eure Login-Daten abgreifen und sich im Netzwerk breitmachen. Das Ergebnis? Eine komplette Kompromittierung eures Active Directory. Autsch! Betroffen sind alle mit Firmware 57.69.91 oder älter.

Also, was tun? Am besten sofort das Service Pack 57.75.53 installieren! Falls das nicht sofort klappt, hier ein paar Sofortmaßnahmen: Setzt ein richtig starkes Admin-Passwort, vermeidet Windows-Accounts mit zu hohen Rechten und schließt die Remote-Control Konsole für Gäste.

Als Pentester sehe ich es leider immer wieder: Drucker werden total unterschätzt! Oft sind sie das perfekte Einfallstor. "Ach, der Drucker..." – und genau da liegt der Hund begraben! Wir brauchen endlich Security by Design, auch bei Druckern!

Habt ihr eure Xerox-Geräte schon überprüft? Welche Erfahrungen habt ihr so mit Drucker-Security gemacht? Erzählt mal! Bin gespannt! 👇 #infosec #pentesting #xerox #drucker

##

updated 2025-02-03T21:31:56

1 posts

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T09:20:47.000Z ##

Leute, haltet euch fest – schon wieder 'ne Sicherheitslücke bei Xerox VersaLink Druckern! 🚨 Diesmal geht's um CVE-2024-12510 und CVE-2024-12511. Und was soll ich sagen? Eure Active Directory Zugangsdaten sind in Gefahr! 💥

Klingt nach 'nem üblen Pass-Back-Angriff über LDAP/SMB/FTP, oder? Und ja, das ist es auch! Ein Angreifer könnte eure Login-Daten abgreifen und sich im Netzwerk breitmachen. Das Ergebnis? Eine komplette Kompromittierung eures Active Directory. Autsch! Betroffen sind alle mit Firmware 57.69.91 oder älter.

Also, was tun? Am besten sofort das Service Pack 57.75.53 installieren! Falls das nicht sofort klappt, hier ein paar Sofortmaßnahmen: Setzt ein richtig starkes Admin-Passwort, vermeidet Windows-Accounts mit zu hohen Rechten und schließt die Remote-Control Konsole für Gäste.

Als Pentester sehe ich es leider immer wieder: Drucker werden total unterschätzt! Oft sind sie das perfekte Einfallstor. "Ach, der Drucker..." – und genau da liegt der Hund begraben! Wir brauchen endlich Security by Design, auch bei Druckern!

"Contec Health CMS8000 Patient Monitor sends out remote access requests to a hard-coded IP address, bypassing existing device network settings to do so. This could serve as a backdoor and lead to a malicious actor being able to upload and overwrite files on the device."

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-31T09:31:57

An issue was discovered in GFI Kerio Control 9.2.5 through 9.4.5. The dest GET parameter passed to the /nonauth/addCertException.cs and /nonauth/guestConfirm.cs and /nonauth/expiration.cs pages is not properly sanitized before being used to generate a Location HTTP header in a 302 HTTP response. This can be exploited to perform Open Redirect or HTTP Response Splitting attacks, which in turn lead t

Nuclei template

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-02-17T14:50:17.000Z ##

CVE-2025-21415 & CVE-2025-21396: Microsoft Addresses Critical Security Risks

Microsoft has addressed two critical security flaws—CVE-2025-21415 and CVE-2025-21396—impacting Azure AI Face Service and Microsoft Account.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/s7cc63

##

CVE-2025-24085
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2025-01-29T15:32:36

1 posts

A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in visionOS 2.3, iOS 18.3 and iPadOS 18.3, macOS Sequoia 15.3, watchOS 11.3, tvOS 18.3. A malicious application may be able to elevate privileges. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 17.2.

1 repos

https://github.com/bronsoneaver/CVE-2025-24085

SteveThompson@mastodon.social at 2025-02-11T23:34:31.000Z ##

Apple’s Zero-Day Exploit Update

https://www.techopedia.com/apple-zero-day-exploit-update

Apple has once again issued a critical security update, this time for CVE-2025-24085, a Use-After-Free (UAF) vulnerability in the Core Media framework.

If exploited, it allows a malicious app to gain elevated privileges, potentially giving hackers deep access to an iPhone or iPad.

Apple has confirmed that the vulnerability has been used in the wild, which means that someone somewhere has already been targeted.

#apple #press

VirusBulletin@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T10:41:03.000Z ##

JPCERT/CC researchers show how the CVE-2025-0282 vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure led to an updated version of the SPAWN family. The SPAWNCHIMERA malware combines the updated functions of SPAWNANT, SPAWNMOLE and SPAWNSNAIL into one. https://blogs.jpcert.or.jp/ja/2025/02/spawnchimera.html

CVE-2024-13176
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-27T21:32:01

2 posts

Issue summary: A timing side-channel which could potentially allow recovering the private key exists in the ECDSA signature computation. Impact summary: A timing side-channel in ECDSA signature computations could allow recovering the private key by an attacker. However, measuring the timing would require either local access to the signing application or a very fast network connection with low lat

st1nger@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-11T18:12:41.000Z ##

#OpenSSL 3.4.1 is a #security patch release. The most severe CVE fixed in this release is High.

This release incorporates the following bug fixes and mitigations:

Fixed RFC7250 handshakes with unauthenticated servers don't abort as expected. (CVE-2024-12797)

Fixed timing side-channel in ECDSA signature computation. (CVE-2024-13176)

https://github.com/openssl/openssl/releases/tag/openssl-3.4.1

##
thedarktangent@defcon.social at 2025-02-11T17:44:05.000Z ##

"OpenSSL 3.4.1 is a security patch release. The most severe CVE fixed in this release is HIGH.

- Fixed RFC7250 handshakes with unauthenticated servers don't abort as expected. (CVE-2024-12797)

- Fixed timing side-channel in ECDSA signature computation. (CVE-2024-13176)"

##

CVE-2024-9310(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-22T21:31:03

1 posts

By utilizing software-defined radios and a custom low-latency processing pipeline, RF signals with spoofed location data can be transmitted to aircraft targets. This can lead to the appearance of fake aircraft on displays and potentially trigger undesired Resolution Advisories (RAs).

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-10T10:30:48.000Z ##

"Vulnerabilities in TCAS II collision warning system for civil aircraft identified by CYD Campus ((NDR Cyber_Defence Campus))

"The CYD Campus has subjected the Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) II used in civil aviation to a comprehensive technical security analysis. The manufacturers and aviation authorities in Europe and the United States have been informed. The published vulnerabilities were classified as moderate and severe, respectively, by the US Cyber Defense Agency CISA and the Federal Aviation Authority (FAA) of the United States.."

"In autumn 2023, the team succeeded in triggering false warnings on a pilot cockpit in their laboratory using a certified TCAS processor from Garmin with its own radio setup. These results were then demonstrated at the DEF CON hacker conference in Las Vegas and at the Usenix security conference in Philadelphia in summer 2024."
👇
https://www.cydcampus.admin.ch/en/vulnerabilities-in-tcas-ii-collision-warning-system-for-civil-aircraft-identified-by-cyd-campus

[related presntation]
⬇️
"On a Collision Course: Unveiling Wireless Attacks to the Aircraft Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS)"
👇
https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity24/presentation/longo

[related CISA advisory]
⬇️
"Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) II"
⬇️
( CVE-2024-9310 )By utilizing software-defined radios and a custom low-latency processing pipeline, RF signals with spoofed location data can be transmitted to aircraft targets. This can lead to the appearance of fake aircraft on displays and potentially trigger undesired Resolution Advisories"
⬇️
( CVE-2024-11166 ) For TCAS II systems using transponders compliant with MOPS earlier than RTCA DO-181F, an attacker can impersonate a ground station and issue a Comm-A Identity Request. This action can set the Sensitivity Level Control (SLC) to the lowest setting and disable the Resolution Advisory (RA), leading to a denial-of-service condition."
👇
https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-25-021-01

#CyberVeille #aviation #advisory #vulnerability #TCAS

updated 2025-01-16T21:32:03

2 posts

SimpleHelp remote support software v5.5.7 and before is vulnerable to multiple path traversal vulnerabilities that enable unauthenticated remote attackers to download arbitrary files from the SimpleHelp host via crafted HTTP requests. ##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T09:01:56.000Z ##

⚠️ Si vous administrez ou utilisez des firewalls SonicWall, patchez dès que possible

Un exploit (CVE-2024-53704) permettant le détournement de sessions SSL VPN sans authentification est désormais public. Des attaquants peuvent ainsi prendre le contrôle de sessions actives et accéder à votre réseau.

🔎 Détails de la vulnérabilité :
✅ Impacte SonicOS versions 7.1.x, 7.1.2-7019 et 8.0.0-8035
✅ Correctifs disponibles dans SonicOS 8.0.0-8037, 7.1.3-7015 et autres versions récentes

Selon les chercheurs de Bishopfox, qui ont publié la démo d'exploitation, 4500 firewalls exposés sur Internet restent vulnérables (scans au 7 février).

🔗 Infos & correctifs :

[Bulletin de sécurité]
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0003

[PoC]
👇
https://bishopfox.com/blog/sonicwall-cve-2024-53704-ssl-vpn-session-hijacking

[Dans les news infosec]
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/sonicwall-firewall-exploit-lets-hackers-hijack-vpn-sessions-patch-now/

Vidéo démonstrative du PoC tirée de l'article dédié de Bishopfox

CVE-2024-10573
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-18T09:31:35

1 posts

An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in mpg123 when handling crafted streams. When decoding PCM, the libmpg123 may write past the end of a heap-located buffer. Consequently, heap corruption may happen, and arbitrary code execution is not discarded. The complexity required to exploit this flaw is considered high as the payload must be validated by the MPEG decoder and the PCM synth before executio

CVE-2024-53104

updated 2024-12-11T15:32:23

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media: uvcvideo: Skip parsing frames of type UVC_VS_UNDEFINED in uvc_parse_format This can lead to out of bounds writes since frames of this type were not taken into account when calculating the size of the frames buffer in uvc_parse_streaming.

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-13T13:44:25.000Z ##

RA World & PlugX, krass! Bestätigt dass APTs sich weiterentwickeln und diversifizieren. Moonlighting-Theorie ist spekulativ, aber möglich. Kenne sowas von Iran oder Nordkorea auch.

CVE-2024-0012 im Auge behalten. Waren die Palo Alto Systeme gepatcht VOR dem Angriff? Zusammenhang sauber verifizieren! Bronze Starlight/Emperor Dragonfly Tradecraft Overlaps sind interessant. Stärkt die China-Hypothese.

Salt Typhoon nutzt bekannte Cisco Schwachstellen. Telekoms und Unis im Visier (Telekommunikation/Engineering/Tech).

Wichtigste Empfehlung: Patchen, patchen, patchen! Palo Alto & Cisco. Härtung: Admin Interfaces nicht ins Internet, EoL Geräte aussortieren. Monitoring für auffällige Netzwerkaktivitäten (GRE Tunnels bei Cisco).

Guter Überblick, aber Moonlighting und CVE-Ursache brauchen mehr Infos. Chinesische APTs bleiben ne Gefahr, Espionage und Ransomware.

Frage mich ob der Angriffsweg über Palo Alto final bestätigt wurde? Gibt es weitere Indikatoren für Bronze Starlight/Emperor Dragonfly? Welche Daten wurden bei den Unis genau geklaut?

CVE-2024-9632
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T21:33:32

2 posts

A flaw was found in the X.org server. Due to improperly tracked allocation size in _XkbSetCompatMap, a local attacker may be able to trigger a buffer overflow condition via a specially crafted payload, leading to denial of service or local privilege escalation in distributions where the X.org server is run with root privileges.

updated 2024-10-29T19:48:12

2 posts

NVIDIA Container Toolkit 1.16.1 or earlier contains a Time-of-check Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability when used with default configuration where a specifically crafted container image may gain access to the host file system. This does not impact use cases where CDI is used. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, informat

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T15:28:41.000Z ##

Alter Falter, NVIDIA! Da knallt's ja schon wieder im Container. CVE-2025-23359, TOCTOU-Race Condition... wer das NVIDIA Container Toolkit oder den GPU Operator nutzt (Kubernetes, ML/AI, aufgepasst!), sollte schleunigst updaten! Sonst gibts Container-Escape vom Feinsten.

Betrifft wohl alle bis 1.17.3 (Toolkit) bzw. 24.9.1 (Operator). Geht um nen Bypass für CVE-2024-0132. Wiz hat's analysiert.

Was passieren kann? Code Execution, DoS, Privilege Escalation, Data Tampering... das volle Programm. Container-Escape bedeutet hier halt Host-Kompromittierung. Also, ran an die Updates! Und lasst das "--no-cntlibs" Flag bloß nicht deaktiviert in Production!

Schonmal nen Container-Escape live gesehen? Ist echt kein Spaß! #infosec #pentesting #containers #kubernetes #nvidia #security #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-7646
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-16T18:31:08

1 posts

A security issue was discovered in ingress-nginx where an actor with permission to create Ingress objects (in the `networking.k8s.io` or `extensions` API group) can bypass annotation validation to inject arbitrary commands and obtain the credentials of the ingress-nginx controller. In the default configuration, that credential has access to all secrets in the cluster.

CVE-2024-7264
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-12T18:31:48

1 posts

libcurl's ASN1 parser code has the `GTime2str()` function, used for parsing an ASN.1 Generalized Time field. If given an syntactically incorrect field, the parser might end up using -1 for the length of the *time fraction*, leading to a `strlen()` getting performed on a pointer to a heap buffer area that is not (purposely) null terminated. This flaw most likely leads to a crash, but can also lead

CVE-2022-47945
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 7.09%

updated 2023-08-17T05:02:41

1 posts

ThinkPHP Framework before 6.0.14 allows local file inclusion via the lang parameter when the language pack feature is enabled (`lang_switch_on=true`). An unauthenticated and remote attacker can exploit this to execute arbitrary operating system commands, as demonstrated by including `pearcmd.php`.

https://github.com/Eutectico/Printnightmare

https://github.com/hlldz/CVE-2021-1675-LPE

lukasberancz@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-17T10:55:40.000Z ##

𝐇𝐎𝐖 𝐓𝐎 𝐃𝐈𝐒𝐀𝐁𝐋𝐄 𝐏𝐑𝐈𝐍𝐓 𝐒𝐏𝐎𝐎𝐋𝐄𝐑 𝐎𝐍 𝐃𝐎𝐌𝐀𝐈𝐍 𝐂𝐎𝐍𝐓𝐑𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐄𝐑𝐒

Print Spooler is a service that takes care of print management. This includes, but is not limited to, managing printer drivers, scheduling print jobs, etc.

Print Spooler had a critical vulnerability in the past referred to as PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-34527). This vulnerability allowed attackers to execute code with administrator privileges.

The Print Spooler vulnerability was patched promptly, so if you have updated systems, the immediate risk associated with PrintNightmare is no longer present. And for normal systems, it is usually not feasible to disable Print Spooler. It would make printing impossible, which is usually not desirable.

But domain controllers are a critical part of Active Directory and need to be as secure as possible, which means blocking everything that is not needed. And you certainly should not need to print on domain controllers, so it’s a good idea to disable Print Spooler on domain controllers.

📺 Watch my YouTube video bellow on how to disable Print Spooler on Domain Controllers 👇 👇
https://youtu.be/O80HHKdnbcQ

#cswlrd #printspooler #domaincontrollers #printnightmare #videotutorial

##

CVE-2020-13393(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.80%

updated 2023-01-29T05:02:45

1 posts

There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the router's web server -- httpd. While processing the /goform/saveParentControlInfo deviceId and time parameters for a POST request, a value is directl

updated 2023-01-27T05:06:25

A privilege chaining vulnerability [CWE-268] in FortiManager and FortiAnalyzer 6.0.x, 6.2.x, 6.4.0 through 6.4.7, 7.0.0 through 7.0.3 may allow a local and authenticated attacker with a restricted shell to escalate their privileges to root due to incorrect permissions of some folders and executable files on the system.

CVE-2025-26466
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

12 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2025-26466

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-19T09:06:55.000Z ##

Qualys dropped another two OpenSSH vulns this week - CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466

I don’t think either are bad, you should keep calm and patch as per usual.

The first one needs a non-default config, and PoC for the second also uses a non-default config. Neither are RCE and I doubt will ever see in the wild exploitation.

Blog: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

Proof of concept: https://www.qualys.com/2025/02/18/openssh-mitm-dos.txt

##
ryanc at 2025-02-19T07:15:11.472Z ##

New SSH CVEs just dropped:

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

##
0x40k at 2025-02-18T19:30:33.985Z ##

Ugh, OpenSSH *again*... Seriously? We've got two fresh vulnerabilities hitting us, CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466. Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) and Denial of Service (DoS). On the surface, it might not seem like a huge deal, but let's be real – SSH is *everywhere*, isn't it? 🙄

Turns out, `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is the culprit behind the MitM vulnerability. So, folks, time to double-check your configs! Otherwise, someone could sneak in and snatch your SSH sessions right out from under you. 😬 And the DoS? That impacts both the client and the server, gobbling up resources left and right. Server goes down, admins get furious, and users get locked out. Not a good look.

Good news, though! OpenSSH 9.9p2 is officially out! So, you know what that means – get patching ASAP! 👍

As a pentester, I constantly see how underestimated SSH is. People are all like, "Oh, it's *just* SSH..." Nope! Security in Depth is absolutely crucial. Customers always want to quickly buy a product instead of getting proper consulting.

So, have you already applied the patch? What SSH hardening tips do you swear by? 🤔

#infosec #openssh #pentest

##
threatcodex at 2025-02-18T18:21:30.010Z ##

Qualys TRU Discovers Two Vulnerabilities in OpenSSH: CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466
#CVE_2025_26465 #CVE_2025_26466
https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

##
Hackread@mstdn.social at 2025-02-18T18:08:37.000Z ##

🚨 Critical #OpenSSH vulnerabilities found! CVE-2025-26465 enables MITM attacks, while CVE-2025-26466 allows DoS. Upgrade to OpenSSH 9.9p2 now to stay protected! 🔒

https://hackread.com/critical-openssh-flaws-expose-users-mitm-dos-attacks/

#CyberSecurity #MITM #DoS #Infosec #Vulnerability

CVE-2025-26624
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-02-18T23:26:47.459Z ##

Y'all seem like the kind of nerds that use Rufus so here's an LPE DLL hijack fixed in v4.7:

https://github.com/pbatard/rufus/security/advisories/GHSA-p8p5-r296-g2jv

A DLL hijacking vulnerability in Rufus 4.6.2208 and earlier versions allows an attacker loading and executing a malicious DLL with escalated privileges (since the executable has been granted higher privileges during the time of launch) due to the ability to inject a malicious cfgmgr32.dll in the same directory as the executable and have it side load automatically.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26624

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T23:26:47.000Z ##

DarkWebInformer at 2025-02-18T21:44:12.257Z ##

🚨 Critical Security Vulnerability
🆔 CVE-2025-26605, CVE-2025-26606, CVE-2025-26607, CVE-2025-26608, CVE-2025-26609, CVE-2025-26610, CVE-2025-26611, CVE-2025-26612, CVE-2025-26613, CVE-2025-26614, CVE-2025-26615, CVE-2025-26616, CVE-2025-26617
💣 CVSS Score: 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10
📅 Published Date: 25/02/18
⚠️ Details: WeGIA is an open source Web Manager for Institutions with a focus on Portuguese language users. A SQL Injection vulnerability was discovered in the WeGIA application, `deletar_cargo.php` endpoint. This vulnerability could allow an authorized attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries, allowing access to sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 3.2.13 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26605

🆔 CVE-2025-26605, CVE-2025-26606, CVE-2025-26607, CVE-2025-26608, CVE-2025-26609, CVE-2025-26610, CVE-2025-26611, CVE-2025-26612, CVE-2025-26613, CVE-2025-26614, CVE-2025-26615, CVE-2025-26616, CVE-2025-26617
💣 CVSS Score: 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10
📅 Published Date: 25/02/18
⚠️ Details: WeGIA is an open source Web Manager for Institutions with a focus on Portuguese language users. A SQL Injection vulnerability was discovered in the WeGIA application, `deletar_cargo.php` endpoint. This vulnerability could allow an authorized attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries, allowing access to sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 3.2.13 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

##

CVE-2025-26603
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-02-18T19:14:40.096Z ##

@reverseics @neurovagrant Another one in vim:

https://github.com/vim/vim/security/advisories/GHSA-63p5-mwg2-787v

Vim allows to redirect screen messages using the :redir ex command to
register, variables and files. It also allows to show the contents of
registers using the :registers or :display ex command.

When redirecting the output of :display to a register, Vim will
free the register content before storing the new content in the
register. Now when redirecting the :display command to a register that
is being displayed, Vim will free the content while shortly afterwards
trying to access it, which leads to a use-after-free.

Vim pre 9.1.1115 checks in the ex_display() function, that it does not
try to redirect to a register while displaying this register at the same
time. However this check is not complete, and so Vim does not check the

  • and * registers (which typically donate the X11/clipboardregisters, and when a clipboard connection is not possible will fallback to use register 0 instead.

In Patch 9.1.1115 Vim will therefore skip outputting to register zero
when trying to redirect to the clipboard registers * or +.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26603

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:14:40.000Z ##

@reverseics @neurovagrant Another one in vim:

https://github.com/vim/vim/security/advisories/GHSA-63p5-mwg2-787v

Vim allows to redirect screen messages using the :redir ex command to
register, variables and files. It also allows to show the contents of
registers using the :registers or :display ex command.

When redirecting the output of :display to a register, Vim will
free the register content before storing the new content in the
register. Now when redirecting the :display command to a register that
is being displayed, Vim will free the content while shortly afterwards
trying to access it, which leads to a use-after-free.

Vim pre 9.1.1115 checks in the ex_display() function, that it does not
try to redirect to a register while displaying this register at the same
time. However this check is not complete, and so Vim does not check the

  • and * registers (which typically donate the X11/clipboardregisters, and when a clipboard connection is not possible will fallback to use register 0 instead.

In Patch 9.1.1115 Vim will therefore skip outputting to register zero
when trying to redirect to the clipboard registers * or +.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26603

This is CVE-2025-21589.

Security Week: Critical Vulnerability Patched in Juniper Session Smart Router https://www.securityweek.com/critical-vulnerability-patched-in-juniper-session-smart-router/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #infosec

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T16:01:40.000Z ##

This is CVE-2025-21589.

Security Week: Critical Vulnerability Patched in Juniper Session Smart Router https://www.securityweek.com/critical-vulnerability-patched-in-juniper-session-smart-router/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #infosec

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T13:17:21.000Z ##

Juniper Authentication Bypass – au weia! 😬 Habt ihr eure Systeme schon unter die Lupe genommen?

CVE-2025-21589, CVSS 9.8 – das ist kein Spaß mehr, sondern brandgefährlich! Betroffen sind Session Smart Router, Conductor und WAN Assurance. Genauer gesagt, die Versionen 5.6.7 bis 6.3.3-r2.

Aber keine Panik, es gibt bereits Abhilfe! Die Fixes sind da: SSR-5.6.17, SSR-6.1.12-lts, SSR-6.2.8-lts, SSR-6.3.3-r2.

WAN Assurance mit Mist Cloud wird automatisch versorgt – aber trotzdem: Patcht lieber einmal zu viel als zu wenig!

Als Pentester sehe ich solche Schwachstellen leider viel zu oft… Das sind Türöffner für das gesamte Netzwerk! Netzwerksegmentierung ist jetzt das A und O.

Was sind eure Top-Tipps für die Router-Härtung? Lasst uns mal austauschen!

#infosec #pentesting #juniper #cve

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T13:16:51.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2025-21589, the vulnerability carries a CVSS v3.1 score of 9.8 and a CVS v4 score of 9.3. https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/juniper-session-smart-routers.html

##
thehackernews@feeds.schraads.com at 2025-02-18T12:39:08.000Z ##

Juniper Session Smart Routers Vulnerability Could Let Attackers Bypass Authentication

Juniper Networks has released security updates to address a critical security flaw impacting Session Smart Router, Session Smart Conductor, and WAN Assurance Router products that could be exploited to hijack control of susceptible devices.
Tracked as CVE-2025-21589, the vulnerability carries a CVSS v3.1 score of 9.8 and a CVS v4 score of 9.3.
"An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or...

https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/juniper-session-smart-routers.html

#tech

obivan@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-12T13:09:00.000Z ##

Critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-24016) in Wazuh server https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh/security/advisories/GHSA-hcrc-79hj-m3qh

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-10T19:18:08.000Z ##

Ooh, this one is even better. An almost perfect sev:CRIT in Wazuh Server.

https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh/security/advisories/GHSA-hcrc-79hj-m3qh

An unsafe deserialization vulnerability allows for remote code execution on Wazuh servers.
The vulnerability can be triggered by anybody with API access (compromised dashboard or Wazuh servers in the cluster) or, in certain configurations, even by a compromised agent.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24016

##

CVE-2025-24032
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-10T16:31:10.000Z ##

The war on "privilege" is already here. sev:CRIT auth bypass in pam_pkcs11 in Linux-PAM. 😆

Don't panic though, read the actual advisory.

https://github.com/OpenSC/pam_pkcs11/security/advisories/GHSA-8r8p-7mgp-vf56

If cert_policy is set to none (the default value), then pam_pkcs11 will only check if the user is capable of logging into the token. An attacker may create a different token with the user's public data (e.g. the user's certificate) and a PIN known to the attacker. If no signature with the private key is required, then the attacker may now login as user with that created token.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24032

##

CVE-2024-37313
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-07T12:31:48.000Z ##

"A code analysis by the BSI shows that two-factor authentication could be bypassed in Nextcloud Server. Passwords were also stored in plain text."
"The high-risk vulnerability reported under CVE-2024-37313 allowed attackers to bypass 2FA and take over an account with credentials known to them"
👇
https://www.heise.de/en/news/BSI-analysis-shows-Nextcloud-server-stored-passwords-in-plain-text-10273259.html

[Patched versions 🩹 ]
⬇️
"It is recommended that the Nextcloud Server is upgraded to 26.0.13, 27.1.8 or 28.0.4

It is recommended that the Nextcloud Enterprise Server is upgraded to 21.0.9.17, 22.2.10.22, 23.0.12.17, 24.0.12.13, 25.0.13.8, 26.0.13, 27.1.8 or 28.0.4"
👇
https://github.com/nextcloud/security-advisories/security/advisories/GHSA-9v72-9xv5-3p7c

[source][DE]
⬇️
"BSI untersucht Open Source Software "Nextcloud""
👇
